medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, LLQ pain, and dry cough for 4 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the evening of the travel day, shortly after the patient had flown and experienced abdominal pain while dining. Initially described as LLQ pain; relief noted after passing flatus. Symptoms progressed with more discomfort, development of non-productive cough, and night sweats. LLQ pain fluctuated in intensity and quality over several days, with variations in bowel movements, including two black stools followed by two normal brown stools.
medical_history.past_medical_history: ESRD secondary to T2DM, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, CAD, and history of TIA.
medical_history.social_history: Recent weight gain of 20 pounds; urination issues noted with multiple stretches of >2hrs between urination.
